Our pitch: At Leg&airy® we are building an AI-platform that  can autonomously fit our pre-designed smart orthopedic devices to a 3D-scan (digital twin) of a human body for common and rare neuro-orthopedic diseases. Our products are smartly produced in one of our fit-factories and are supplied to the patients directly in the clinic. Our products come with integrated sensors to learn more about patient wearing behavior and to continuously improve our proprietary fitting experience and the design of our products.

Problem:
 
Humans (and especially children) with chronic or acute neuro-orthopedic conditions tremendously suffer from badly fitted orthopedic devices - the braces don't support them the way they should or hurt them causing pressure ulcers. In some cases, orthopedic devices are supplied too late so that symptoms already worsen, or the products even injure patients due to poor fitting. This leads to massive frustration for patients who depend on orthopedic devices to retain or regain their mobility.

Emost AG is on a mission to create an ecosystem that enables easy and reliable access to clean energy off the grid. It is driven by the vision that the world shall become free of diesel generators.  Its first product is a mobile battery to replace diesel generators in the building, event, and film industries. The market for green off-grid electricity solutions is growing rapidly. The serviceable market in Europe alone is estimated at 23 bn EUR. The business has very direct environmental benefits as the replaced diesel generators produce about 70% more CO2 per kWh than a coal-fired power plant. Hence, emost will sell units over the next five years with a lifetime CO2 reduction of 930’000 tons.
The founding team has successfully worked together for several years, bringing key experience in engineering, sales, analytics, business management, as well as founding and growing start-ups in the climate change area to the unicorn status.

Our first product is Candli. Candli is a transmedia platform that enables aspiring designers and programmers of all ages to create video games with revolutionary speed and ease — combining pencil-and-paper art with accessible visual programming methods. With Candli, a person with no prior training can scan their own drawings and pictures and, with only a handful of visual rules, assemble them into a fully-functional video game. In one click, they can then share their game online with friends.

Our vision is that Candli becomes a transmedia game ecosystem in which the player takes the role of a game creator, gently being given the key skills to become a creative hero builder. This ecosystem will feature multiple tiers suited for various ages, starting with an interactive colouring book for young children, up to advanced features such as mathematical functions for older ones. Hence, Candli will provide a support for education, in the fields of development of personal creativity, video game design and history, computer science, mathematics, physics, and others.

Rapidata solves a fundamental problem faced by the modern AI industry. AI tools and systems, like ChatGPT, autonomous driving or magic erase, rely on massive amounts of data and the secret of the industry is that this data needs to be filtered, annotated and validated by enormous amounts of repetitive human labor in low cost countries. This is slow, expensive, and most of all, not scalable. Rapidata solves this by not relying on a fixed workforce, instead we have an existing network of Millions of People around the world that we can access through the same technology as digital ads. This allows us to offer 1000x faster human-verified data processing at scale, while being more affordable than the competition. At the same time we offer a revolutionary new way to monetize free web services!

Scewo – Mobility redefined

Scewo AG is the result of a student project at ETH and ZHdK in 2017. The young team produces the world’s only electric wheelchair that combines driving on two wheels and climbing stairs. The Scewo BRO can be operated without torso stability, is able to master uneven surfaces, ensures easy transferring and makes it possible to talk to other people at eye level. Thanks to the unique combination of technology and design, the Scewo BRO not only moves people, but also inspires a change in thinking. The work of the 55-strong team has already received several awards, including the Swiss MedTech Award 2021, the German Design Award 2021, the iF Design Award 2019 and the RedDot Award 2019 Best of the Best.

•	In order to maintain a resilient society that is equipped to face future challenges, it is imperative that we strengthen the smallest units of society.

Wachmeister sind revolutionäre Koffein Mate Bonbons, die nicht nur durch ihren Geschmack überzeugen, sondern auch durch ihre außergewöhnlichen Eigenschaften. Diese kleinen Bonbons sind mehr als nur eine süße Leckerei – sie sind regelrechte Energiebooster, die darauf ausgelegt sind, euch einen nachhaltigen Energieschub zu verleihen.

Aber was genau steckt in diesen Bonbons? Nun, zum einen haben wir Koffein, einen Wachmacher, den viele von euch bereits kennen. Koffein hilft, die Müdigkeit zu vertreiben und die Konzentration zu steigern. Doch bei Wachmeister gehen wir noch einen Schritt weiter. Neben Koffein enthalten diese Bonbons auch Mate. Mate ist eine Pflanze aus Südamerika, die für ihre belebenden Eigenschaften bekannt ist. Die Kombination von Koffein und Mate führt zu einer sanften und langanhaltenden Energiequelle, die euren Geist wach hält und euch bei euren täglichen Herausforderungen unterstützt.

Eine großartige Eigenschaft von Wachmeister Bonbons ist die Möglichkeit, die Koffein-Dosis individuell zu steuern. Ihr könnt ganz nach euren Bedürfnissen entscheiden, wann ihr einen Energieschub benötigt. Egal, ob es sich um den frühen Morgen handelt, wenn die Augen noch schwer sind, oder um den Nachmittag, wenn die Konzentration nachlässt – mit Wachmeister könnt ihr gezielt eure Energie steigern.

Darüber hinaus sind Wachmeister Bonbons perfekt für unterwegs. Ihr könnt sie überallhin mitnehmen, sei es ins Büro, zum Training oder auf Reisen. Das bedeutet, dass ihr nicht mehr auf eine Tasse Kaffee oder ein Energy-Getränk angewiesen seid, um euren Energiepegel hoch zu halten.

Ein weiteres bemerkenswertes Merkmal von Wachmeister Bonbons ist ihre Fähigkeit, frischen Atem zu verleihen. Ihr kennt sicherlich das unangenehme Gefühl, wenn euch der Atem während eines geschäftigen Tages im Stich lässt. Mit Wachmeister könnt ihr nicht nur eure Energie steigern, sondern auch selbstbewusst auftreten, da ihr wisst, dass euer Atem frisch ist.

Entdeckt die Welt von Wachmeister – Bonbons, die nicht nur schmecken, sondern auch eine Quelle der Energie und des Wohlbefindens sind.

Acute Myeloid Leukaemia (AML) and Myelodysplastic Neoplasms (MDS) are aggressive hematologic diseases, primarily affecting the elderly. Current consolidation treatment with allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation (allo-HCT), is effective but associated with high risks, including severe complications, reduced quality of life, and low survival rates. Furthermore, old and comorbid AML and MDS patients are not eligible for allo-HCT and face a very short survival (<1 year).

Our solution, ALY117, is a novel CD117xCD3 bispecific antibody. It targets CD117, which is expressed on both normal and malignant hematologic cells. ALY117 engages T cells, facilitating their binding to CD117+ cells and activation, ultimately leading to T cell-mediated killing of these cells. This innovative approach offers a promising alternative to current conditioning regiments, reaching a "sweetspot" between safety and efficacy and ultimately reduce complications associated with allo-HSCT.

Despite a growing number of FDA-approved cancer drugs half of all cancer
patients do not respond or become resistant to treatment. The reason for
the poor outcomes of many cancer patients is not the unavailability of drugs,
but the fact that oncologists lack the tools to choose the most suitable
treatment for each patient among the available options. At the same time,
many clinical trials fail due to a lack of information to identify responders to
novel drugs. How do we bring the right drug to each patient?

We have developed a highly informative approach to analyze tumor tissue
based on spatial single-cell proteomics. We have demonstrated the
usefulness of our approach to provide personalized treatment decision
support for clinicians and to provide valuable insight to accelerate oncology
drug development. Our vision is to create a digital tumor based on hundreds
of thousands of spatial single-cell tumor profiles with associated clinical
and treatment outcome data, which will allow us to continuously improve
our recommendations to clinical and pharma partners and discover novel
biomarkers.
